website_summaries.verdict: A fabulously priced teaching toy that allows beginners to explore accordion in the key of C.
pros: A tiny, budget-priced instrument with decent sound quality
Great for those who want to experiment with the accordion
cons: Bellow's pleats are made of stiff, reinforced paper
Difficult for smaller hands to manipulate
Only plays in the key of C

customer_reviews.title: Great chicken toy.
customer_reviews.text: Attached it to the wall of my chicken coop and the chickens play it often.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drum for my 10 month old son - excited to give it to him. It’s the first time I’ve purchased a product from this brand. It arrived yesterday and unfortunately, the sides of the drum are dented/ crushed. Very disappointing. It seemed well packaged so I’m assuming the fault is on the manufacturer’s end for not checking the quality of the product before shipping it out.
customer_reviews.author: MV

customer_reviews.title: purchased the xylophone for my chickens. put black dots ...
customer_reviews.text: purchased the xylophone for my chickens. put black dots on the keys and the girls peck at it for entertainment (themselves and us!)
customer_reviews.author: jsc

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This was such a hit with my grandchildren! Their mother had played bells in church as a child and she gave them a quick lesson (not really needed!) and they not only caught on quickly but started practicing and playing songs solo and as a group. Awesome. Bells are well made and have a quality sound. Excellent product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ali Gustafson

customer_reviews.title: Love this Accordion!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Granddaughter for her 7th birthday. I must confess, I bought it to see the reaction of my daughter when she saw another "loud toy" She insisted it stay at my home, I'm so glad she did. This is a real accordion just smaller for smaller hands. I never noticed, but no matter what you do with an accordion it always sounds good lol It really does, My Granddaughter & I have been having such a great time with it! She says when she plays, the music sounds sad and when I play the music sounds so happy, a lot of fun, totally recommend
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: My daughter might not be crazy about it but my grandson and myself love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as part of my grandsons first birthday presents and he loves it. I thought that he would just bang on it with his hands like he does my coffee table but he actually likes to hit it with the little drum sticks. He’s so cute with his drum on, it stays in place wonderfully, walking around with a stick in each hand banging on his little drum. It is more than worth it, especially when he takes it home with him. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Great hand bells that sound wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great hand bells that sound wonderful. They are metal with sturdy plastic handles. The letter stickers on top of the handles will easily fall off, but super glue or permanent marker will work nicely. Otherwise, each bell is imprinted with a number. 1 represents middle C, 2 represents B, 3 represents D, etc. They come in a plastic container that can be reused for storage if you don't have something better. The bells come with 8 short songs that include matching colored letters that correspond with each bell.
customer_reviews.author: DMA

customer_reviews.title: This was perfect push box to get him back into playing
customer_reviews.text: My grandfather played the accordion growing up and in a band that traveled the US back in the late 40s-60s and in his older age I wanted to get him something to play around with. This was perfect push box to get him back into playing, after a little while I wish it had a few more keys but I can't say anything bad about it
customer_reviews.author: CNasty

customer_reviews.title: Nice sounding drum and sturdy strap
customer_reviews.text: This drum is perfect for my almost 3 yr old. She loves having impromptu parades. The sound off the drum is relatively deep, and not very annoying (I find noisy electronic toys much more aggravating anyway) I do wish there was some way of attaching the drumsticks for storage, a little pouch on the neck strap maybe? As it is, she looses them easily. Still, that's a small complaint for what is a nice drum.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Zee

customer_reviews.title: Great quality sounds
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great instrument toy. It doesn’t have cheap sounds but good quality. It will help your little one lungs’ to get stronger. You can play different tunes on it. And it even plays a chord!!! Means 3 or 4 sounds at the same time. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Great gift...solid quality toy!
customer_reviews.text: A great gift for any child...plays well...built well and stands up to lots of play ....one of my favorite gifts to give...very good quality item !
customer_reviews.author: GoMom5

customer_reviews.title: It's held up to our rowdy 2 year old grandson!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Our grandson's favorite toy since he was 18 months old. Very durable and he loves the strap that comes with it, so he can march around the room while watching Drum Line videos. This "toy" has really pushed his interest in music and all the other instruments. He can keep time like a percussionist in a Jr High band, thanks to this little jewel of a toy. Excellent starter drum with little balls inside to keep them interested when all else fails. Would but again for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B17

customer_reviews.title: Good, but small
customer_reviews.text: This was good, but I was hoping it would be lower key. I will replace the wood with rubber mallets to get the sound I wanted. It’s also smaller than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: julia hogan

customer_reviews.title: Just a note on the piano horn
customer_reviews.text: Where the item description says "its two instruments in one with keys you can press and a horn you can blow," i took that to mean that the instrument makes noises when you press the keys without needing to blow into it. Just to be clear, you do need to blow into the instrument for any noise to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Hard to pull apart but that's probably why it works
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is a good introduction to little kids, but it takes a dedicated little musician to get past the difficulty of pulling it to draw the air in. It's pretty hard for anyone under 6. Even makes my arm a little tired as an adult. However, that is the reason it doesn't sound like a cheapie thing. The hand strap is pretty small for a larger kid or an adult to slip their hand under but if you can it will work ok, although the keys are situated for shorter fingers as well. Just fyi.
customer_reviews.author: snicktacular

customer_reviews.title: More than a Toy
customer_reviews.text: Jokingly my husband said he wanted an accordion for his birthday. Ask and ye shall receive. This thing rocks for a novelty! He plays it for my granddaughter and she is captivated. It comes with a little booklet with some songs and is made quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Lou

customer_reviews.title: Less than 8 days or 10 minutes of playing, maracas paint smudged and handles came out. See photo
customer_reviews.text: We received really cute maracas on 2/11 for less than $3 each. My 17 months old child loved them. Today is 2/19 and the paints are smudging and the handles came off. She has so many toys, she played with it maybe cumulative 10 minutes so far. So sad, but this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jan N. K.

customer_reviews.title: Didn`t like it.
customer_reviews.text: I have returned it. Not what I was expected. Bought for my 3 year old son. I hear more of accordion furs moving than actual sound. Those straps attached in odd place and on the way. I had toy accordion in my childhood, so I know how it could be and this one is not the same quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: small accordion
customer_reviews.text: I'm 63 years old and I bought it to see if I want to upgrade to something better at a later date, it makes noise and you can play some songs, more for a child but I have fun with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Granger

customer_reviews.title: Great stage prop.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a scene from Harold Pinter's The Birthday Party that I had directed. Rediculously cute, very visible. The balls rolling around in the middle were tricky for the actor to hold still while in the wings but added to the comedic effect. I imagine this may get tiring if you give it to a kid for too long
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin A.

customer_reviews.title: Out of tune
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my grandson who loves creating his own music. I was hopping that we are going to have a great time but! The note A is totally out of tune and it ruined everything!!! Now I am not even able to return it. Feel scammed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alaska5

customer_reviews.title: Love it sounds beautiful :)
customer_reviews.text: Great size, reminds me of a piano you pull. My son loves it and my family is cirtacia (circadian) so this is THE instrument for there culture and they haven’t put it down in 2 hours I’m blown away.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Levitt

customer_reviews.title: Great little drum for kids
customer_reviews.text: This toy drum is the favorite of the band instruments of my preschool class of 3-4 year olds. It has a sturdy construction that has held up to little ones beating on it very hard. It also sounds very nice when played by some of the more musically inclined students!
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Fair

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth a penny
customer_reviews.text: Save your money. This product is useless. Hardly had any sound. I should have listened to the 1-2 star reviews as I was viewing the product for they are indeed correct
customer_reviews.author: SBP

customer_reviews.title: Big sound
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my nephew. He loves it, and it even inspired my grandma to pull out her accordion! Sounds good, all the notes work. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: BluesMuze

customer_reviews.title: ... obnoxious loud toy for my nephew - it was perfect. The kids LOVE it and have no problems ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to be an obnoxious loud toy for my nephew - it was perfect. The kids LOVE it and have no problems squeezing it and pressing the buttons (ages 6 and 3 have played with it). It is a very nice quality and real accordion, not just some cheap kids plastic toy. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and what you expect for price.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and what you expect for price. I would have given 5 stars due to the fun and quality, but want to note 3 improvements they could make: -stickers on handle tops need to hold better (we just wrote the letters on the missing ones) -more songs and - larger print on the included song sheet These 3 would bring the bells up to perfect value for the money. Still, I am happy we purchased this one because the bells will last through out childhood. Other music sheets are available by themselves from other vendors.
customer_reviews.author: Luvagoodproduct!

customer_reviews.title: ukulele has no intonation! Frets coming up also!
customer_reviews.text: Garbage nothing but a wall hanger. ukulele has no intonation. So it can’t even be played. Neck is broken and frets are coming up! Very disappointed with amazon business practices!
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: made a little princess day
customer_reviews.text: i got this for my 2 year old niece i play drums and she loves to play on my pearl set every chance she gets so i got her this small drum to play on for her 2 birthday made her day.
customer_reviews.author: sickmfer

customer_reviews.title: Bell handle arbitrarily came loose in first couple uses
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have mentioned, the stickers come off almost before you receive the product. Our red bell arbitrarily loosened during normal (non-violent) use, which has compromises the sound. I pulled the plastic handle off and attempted to jam it back into place, but was unsuccessful at achieving the perfect fit. We still have a 1/4 inch space between the handle and the bell. Without all bells being functional, it is not able to be used "as a set" which is the point. You can't play a very broad repertoire without one of eight notes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old LOVES his new "guitar"! And the price is really great if you're buying for a toddler. For the price, it's surprisingly sturdy and attractive. This is not an instrument for a beginner as it doesn't actually tune. It is definitely a toy, but it's a great toy that looks realistic. It was the least expensive gift my toddler got for X-mas, but it has definitely been his favorite!
customer_reviews.author: kimberly mackay

customer_reviews.title: Kid loves it but not that durable
customer_reviews.text: My kid LOVES this drum. But he put the drum sticks through the clear plastic in two days. Now the whole thing is reinforced with packing tape and it’s holding it together for the moment! No regrets for the price given his adoration.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolle Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my nieces son. Oh the fun. His MiMi has swarm to pay me back. I'm just helping start the band.... Oh did I mean that I also purchased a ukulele too??
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fun but not the best sound
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed. The sound is dull and the stickers that label them with the notes they play have all fallen off in the past 12 hours. They are bright and colorful and are a generally fun toy but they are not the quality musical instruments I thought they would be and therefor not worth the somewhat higher price, in my opinion. I also thought, for some reason, that they had wooden handles but I was mistaken and they do not. I'd be happy with them at a lower price that reflects that they are just plastic toys and not a quality wooden instrument. I will be saving up for the wooden pat bells.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Read more to find out if this is loud or quiet...
customer_reviews.text: It plays sounds, horn-combined-with-piano-like sounds. But they are so loud. I should have expected that outcome. It was stupid of me not to. But, if you’re into very loud plastic instruments that make pianoey/horntype sounds, then this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: AV

customer_reviews.title: An Educational toy 'for grannies'
customer_reviews.text: This is fun But way too hard far a young child to operate - even an old lady at times - haven't quite figured out how to hold it properly to get the right synchronization (I love spell check) Practice Practice Practice
customer_reviews.author: Persnickety periwinkle

customer_reviews.title: BEST DRUMER BOY EVER! PAYBACK!! LOVE BUBBLES  YOUR GRANDMOTHER!
customer_reviews.text: Lov rd this drum. Sent this to my 2 year old grandson and he loves it. Marches around the house banging it! I suggested he wake his parents up in the morning with some drum music and Marching! Paybacks are great!! Seller is great. Arrived quickly and as promised.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: good brain trainer
customer_reviews.text: Nice gift given to my friend's 3 year old daughter. I was a little concerned at first because the bellows were rather stiff requiring a bit of strength to produce sound. She loved it! I got her twin 3 year old sister a piano flute and they both were parading around the x-mas tree with big smiles. Mom and dad weren't so annoyed as the sounds complimented well. The accordion is diatonic - sounds are within a strict range.(no sour notes) Built with good enough quality to stay intact throughout the holiday season. However, 2 months later a button fell out, introducing the noted "choking hazard". No big deal for these 3 year olds, though.
customer_reviews.author: buybot181

customer_reviews.title: YOU ONLY GET ONE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read the fine print as well. I must have skipped the part where it says ITEMS SOLD SEPARATELY. I bought the item thinking I was getting two as that is what the picture leads you to believe. I basically spent $10 for one item due to shipping. I will be returning the item and buying a SET for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Jones

customer_reviews.title: I'm speaking 5 years ahead of time.
customer_reviews.text: I got this accordion for Christmas 2015.AND ITS STILL IN FANTASTIC CONDITION!!!! It goes from a a cord to a f cord.Perfect for starters like me.Its like any ordinary accordion...DURABLE. I've really liked playing it. #IMHORRIBLEATACCORDIN
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for my grandson. My grandson is 2 years old and he loves it. I will be purchasing this item again. I have a new grandson on the way and he will surely get one as well.
customer_reviews.author: LaTanya Fields

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 2 year old for Christmas. However it's a poor design as the horn is in three pieces and doesn't stay together. The mouthpiece and the horn part both pop off constantly and it's annoying to have to keep looking for and putting the pieces together so he can play it. Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: ZvilleMom

customer_reviews.title: Little bigger than I thought.
customer_reviews.text: It’s just one maraca. Bigger than I expected. It seems sturdy. So big that scared my son with its sound. It’s cute. Definitely keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Simbel Ayse

customer_reviews.title: Classic Drum
customer_reviews.text: Absolute classic toy and I love that the strap is detachable for safety purposes. (I actually left the strap off completely until my daughter was older and walking.) The clear top and bottom of the drum add a new dimension of fun to the toy as children are able to watch the balls bounce around inside when it is tapped or shook.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This horn is cute and good quality with a pretty nice sound and would have gotten a 5. HOWEVER, the 7th key should be a B but instead is a B flat and while this might not seem like a huge deal, it totally is because you can’t play any songs that require a B! My kids are musical and know the difference. I hope that I just got a defective one and that it’s not a flaw in the design. I will likely be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: polloi

customer_reviews.title: Not well made.
customer_reviews.text: Xylophone is red, not blue. It is poorly made, came apart easily. Keys are not even or secured very well. I am sending this item back.
customer_reviews.author: Jra

customer_reviews.title: He loves it.
customer_reviews.text: i got this for my 3 year old son. he loves!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nubia

customer_reviews.title: You never know if you have a budding artist.
customer_reviews.text: They young ladies who got this for Christmas were so excited. They started playing it immediately. A great gift for any child who like music.
customer_reviews.author: Grannycasp

customer_reviews.title: Great instrument for little ones
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 2-y.o. son and he really enjoys it, even though he seems to prefer to play it upside down (i.e. keys on the underside) most of the time. It has a rather decent pitch and it always plays a note, even when no keys are depressed. It's also never too loud, even when the kids (my 5-y.o. uses it too) blow really hard into it. We have at least 2 other instruments that, when blown into strongly, make a shrill whistle. This doesn't do that and that's a large part of why I like it. Plus, the notes this one does play, seem to be in tune.
customer_reviews.author: S. Surasky

customer_reviews.title: The maracas as fine, but the picture as advertised is completely wrong
customer_reviews.text: The maracas as fine, but the picture as advertised is completely wrong. I've read more reviews after purchasing & wish I had done so beforehand... you would think these come as a set of 2, but it's only 1 maraca. Bit pricey for what you get!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Though red not blue
customer_reviews.text: I loved this xylophone!! Except we ordered it because it was blue and it came red. But the sound quality and the craftsmanship made it worth keeping. Although I will say our son has given it a run for its money banging on it and tossing it. The parts have held up well! But the paint durability is not quite as strong as I’d hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C  Barber

customer_reviews.title: Cute and colorful. Can be restrung with better strings and actually holds tune.
customer_reviews.text: Cute little ukulele. Bought to use as a wall decoration. Need to change strings and will be playable for more than just a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: We like to use these with our kids to play songs
customer_reviews.text: We like to use these with our kids to play songs, especially at Christmas. The bells themselves work well, but the stickers with the letter/note fell off very easily and we had to use permanent marker to write on the handles. The plastic "box" they came in is also not very durable and fell apart quickly. I'm happier with a different set that came in a cardboard box and the stickers stay on. But functionally we've been happy.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: These are Wonderful! Every household that has these bells on display ...
customer_reviews.text: These are Wonderful! Every household that has these bells on display for any child, who lives there or visits, will give joy to all! Kids from age four to nine have visited me. Two sets of these bells sit right where they can be easily accessed. These bells are played. They are loved and enjoyed. The sound is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Skyla

customer_reviews.title: Very nice musical toy - great brand
customer_reviews.text: Love this little accordion. Very easy to play and a fun gift for our three-year-old. The instructions aren't that clear but it's really a toy - we're not planning on him joining a polka band any time soon or anything. Just wanted a fun toy to try to bring some more music into his life, and this is a great one. Schylling overall has been a great brand for our musical toys. This one is very well made for the price, and I hope we will get lots of play out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon-aholic

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality is perfect It feels sturdy and it's extremely giftable
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this horn. It's sound quality somehow rivals the top Yamaha melodica but feels so unique and whimsical to play. I love this item so much and I will definitely get one for my friend
customer_reviews.author: Amy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Lovely little instrument
customer_reviews.text: This xylophone is beautifully made, with bright colors, clear sound, and the keys are labeled with the notes Kids are drawn to it and adults like to play too
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: This arrived a dented mess. Material almost as thin as a soda can. If it doesnt arrive broken it will be within 24 hours with the use of any child.
customer_reviews.author: SHAR

customer_reviews.title: Adorable and long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, will last a long time. This was my second time purchasing this exact maraca, the last one I bought 8 years ago. Also, very cute.
customer_reviews.author: FishTarTar

customer_reviews.title: the sound is actually not bad
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 2.5 year old because he's into Little Einsteins and names all the instruments. He hasn't gotten down the blowing yet, and makes noise with his voice instead. The bottom part of the horn falls off easily, so my husband is going to super glue it. The sound is actually not a horrible one, and I come from a musical background. I gave it four stars because all the keys are on one side, so that's a lot of work for one hand to do. At this point, my son pushes down one key and "blows" over and over and over again.
customer_reviews.author: Keri-Ann

customer_reviews.title: Handles come loose.
customer_reviews.text: Fun little maracas. Very loud clear sounds. The wooden handle came loose immediately (with adult use) and had to be reglued. Went together nicely with some wood glue. Kind of a let down color can’t be chosen.
customer_reviews.author: FiestyBerry

customer_reviews.title: Decent but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected. My kid liked it well enough though. Seems to be functionally sound.
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Red not blue
customer_reviews.text: The major thing is it is red not blue as pictured. I ordered this particular one because it was navy blue. However, it is a xylophone and it works. I bought it for my two year old’s birthday and she can play it. It is a bit tight as others have mentioned but not a huge deal for a two year old.
customer_reviews.author: Maeghen

customer_reviews.title: wow for the price this is great. its an actual accordion
customer_reviews.text: wow for the price this is great. its an actual accordion. I half expected a kazoo on steroids but this is an actual little accordion dosn't sound to bad for a kids toy. If you are from Texas chances are you have Mexican, Slavic or German roots so get your kids in touch with your roots early and give them an Accordion to play with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: The front part of it doesn't hold well: it's so loose that comes off all time and then it's not working at all. Because it's a small part it's very hard to locate it and the child doesn't want to play with it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: s k

customer_reviews.title: Schylling Xylophone Not Worth a Shilling
customer_reviews.text: I am horrified by this product - if you don't have any musical inclination at all and just want something that makes noise, then this toy is for you. If you have even a smidgen of respect for music, you will buy this toy so that you can set it on fire and perhaps save some poor child from being forever scarred. Think of the children! Three of the notes on this xylophone are not out of key, THEY ARE ENTIRELY THE WRONG NOTES! The notes are labelled in the C scale, but three are completely wrong. And Amazon is not letting me return it - I wonder why.
customer_reviews.author: David P Booman

customer_reviews.title: Not a xylophone
customer_reviews.text: Received a child’s drawing toy, not the xylophone pictured. No returns accepted? Out the money. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Boise83704

customer_reviews.title: Cool Starter Instrument or silly gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave this little guy as a silly gift. Actually works and comes with easy to understand instructions. Definitely makes a great gift or a starter instrument for a kiddo.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Sat this next to my 3D printer and told people it made it. HaHa!
customer_reviews.text: Sat this next to my 3D printer and told people it made it. HaHa! PS - It sounds okay.
customer_reviews.author: Sammichman

customer_reviews.title: o.k.purchase
customer_reviews.text: the bells are in tube enough for our little class abduction the kids have fun with them. on the otherhand they break (the inside spring gets loose or unscrews and then the bell becomes loose from the handle and is hard or impossible to play). we have 2 to 5 year olds playing them. we never let them just casually play around with them and stress carefulness during practice. the price was relatively cheap, but i think in the future i would pay more for a better quality set. (i had to purchase a whole other set of these bells just to replace the two loose ones)
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: ventriloquist and it was easy to learn a couple songs to include in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well made for the price. I work as a clown, magician, ventriloquist and it was easy to learn a couple songs to include in my act. Fun.
customer_reviews.author: Gibby

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $1
customer_reviews.text: Plastic top broke within first hour. Strap plastic broke two days later. Crap product.
customer_reviews.author: Rafu

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but the design won't last
customer_reviews.text: The incredibly cute design was the reason I chose these maracas over the plain (but durable) ones made by another company. I bought two (as they are sold individually) to use in my 14 m/o's Easter basket and we lucked out in getting the yellow. I can tell right away that the design will be gone within a year, but the toy seemed solid enough after being whacked about (and against each other). My wee one enjoys making the shaker noise and they are fulfilling their purpose for as long as they last. In the end, it will be a craft project to paint the design back on.
customer_reviews.author: Guinevere Wild

customer_reviews.title: Musical Fun
customer_reviews.text: Fun, musical toy for my grandson. Good discovery of music / notes / options / buttons, etc to get the child thinking about various actions that help create or change the tones. The tonal quality is not tinny or toy-like, but pretty decent. The construction of this toy is durable.
customer_reviews.author: MamaJo

customer_reviews.title: i love it
customer_reviews.text: it is very well made. and sounds wonderful. i play along with alexa playing music. i have great time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The hard plastic material seems sturdy enough although if it was dropped on a hard ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my 19 year-old son who has Down syndrome. He loves to listen to music and make music as well. He enjoys playing this although it takes a lot of breath to produce the notes. The hard plastic material seems sturdy enough although if it was dropped on a hard surface floor it would surely crack or break. Having said that, it is a nice musical instrument for the amount of money paid.
customer_reviews.author: Harriet

customer_reviews.title: Not super kid friendly
customer_reviews.text: Hard for children to use because it takes a bit of effort to open and close. Sound quality is great and it looks sturdy, but doesn't stand up well to an accidental drop. Seems like something a kids instrument should be able to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret M1

customer_reviews.title: its the greatest thing ever
customer_reviews.text: Its a toy. Doesnt really keep a tune but for a child, its the greatest thing ever. They treat it like a real guitar and you dont have to spend iver a hundred dollars on a real child's guitar that is still going to sound crappy.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining!
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted something silly to de-stress. Very inexpensive, entertaining and easy to use. I'm not exactly popping out whole songs, but when I need to just sit for a few minutes and clear my mind, this gets pulled out. I'm sure my neighbors love me! Might be a bit harder for smaller kids, but my older kids do fine and it frequently get's "stolen" by my husband. I would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: blankenmom

customer_reviews.title: Funny looking but fun
customer_reviews.text: It's fun. My little sisters loved it. Even my dad tried making music with it.
customer_reviews.author: Fern

customer_reviews.title: Fun for big and small - excellent for special needs struggling with recorder
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my special needs son who struggled with playing recorder during his music class and home. This was excellent idea. That piano horn was a hit. The sound is excellent, easy to play. We all enjoyed it. Music teacher left is in the room so I will have to get another one. The only thing is that the end has two pieces for easy clean up and it was falling of. I just taped it and it works.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Not marked as a Schylling, as shown by seller
customer_reviews.text: The one I received had no markings on it to indicate that it was truly a Schylling accordion. The thumb strap loosened immediately, exposing the sharp edges of the fasteners. The pamphlet that was mostly written in Chinese, and was very difficult to follow. The accordion sounded good, but it did not meet my expectations, and I'm not even sure I got a Schylling.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer S.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to play and inexpensive!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive (and therefore not super sturdy) and easy to play! My son already has a harmonium. This is easier to play, but fairly flimsy. Great produc for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Gina DV

customer_reviews.title: I Got Scammed.
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the reviews. It clearly states "Maracas" with as S and shows six. Nowhere does it say you only get one. Pretty, good noise, but the price is high for one.
customer_reviews.author: DubbyF

customer_reviews.title: It is a very nice instrument. She uses her's a lot and I ...
customer_reviews.text: I got two so I could play with my granddaughter, age 4. It is a very nice instrument. She uses her's a lot and I expect I will give mine to her if she needs it. So far her piano horn is holding up. She is not rough with it so I expect it will be functional for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Super fun musical instrument
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my toddler and I think the entire family has played it as much as she has. Great quality. Super fun musical instrument
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Opened it and played for five minutes and two of ...
customer_reviews.text: Opened it and played for five minutes and two of the buttons got pushed into the toy and can't get out:(
customer_reviews.author: janet s robinson

customer_reviews.title: My niece loved it! It's a very noisy toy
customer_reviews.text: Oh, the noise! Oh, the noise! Oh, the noise, noise, noise, noise! I bought this as a revenge gift for a megaphone that they gave to my son. My niece loved it! It's a very noisy toy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for a present
customer_reviews.text: It's a cute toy for a present. I think a baby will have fun playing with it.
customer_reviews.author: GlanzTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Loud and makes a great gift
customer_reviews.text: My niece loves this which means my sister hates it but it is great
customer_reviews.author: John S

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: The balls in the drum make for even more banging noises and my grandson loves this! Its very durable and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Misty Lowrey

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: I saw someone playing one of these on utube, and it looked so fun I just had to get one. I was surprised that you can play more than one button at a time!!! I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: brenda

customer_reviews.title: Great introduction to musical instruments.
customer_reviews.text: This little maracas is really cute. My grandson (11 months) loves music, so we have "music time" every day. He gets very excited when we pull them out & this is usually the first thing he grabs.
customer_reviews.author: tracydobbs

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these earlier in the year for my son who is 6. He had been wanting one for a long time after watching a You Tube video of a man playing one. My son loves it. Quality and sound is great for the price! I recently ordered a second one for my daughter who is almost 3 because she couldn't stop borrowing her brother's. Both of them have a lot of fun with these and play them frequently. I totally recommend this. It's a great toy to help kids learn about music and to just have fun!
customer_reviews.author: T. Lumb

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, easy to use, super fun
customer_reviews.text: The best toy wind instrument I've tried. Satisfying for all ages. Great sound. Handle broke but it's extraneous.
customer_reviews.author: JoH

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my daughter (@ 20 months) and she's still intermittently playing with them 4 months later. She's could care less about the different tones each bell makes, but instead just loves to ring them to make noise from time-to-time. 5 stars simply because a child will play with them for more than 2 weeks ;) Note: paint scratches off easily if bells are banged together... kids will be kids...
customer_reviews.author: Tobey

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: It works.....no complaints. It has a nice sound. I was looking for a plain wooden one with no frills. I was expecting blue as pictured but received red, no biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie's mum

customer_reviews.title: Gateway instrument
customer_reviews.text: Good for a children's toy. Able to play a few nursery rhymes, great to add to collection of toddler musical instruments
customer_reviews.author: melania

customer_reviews.title: ... Drum with Adjustable Strap and Two Drum Sticks is great for four year old children
customer_reviews.text: The Schylling TD Tin Drum with Adjustable Strap and Two Drum Sticks is great for four year old children. The size is perfect to put the strap over the head and walk about playing the drum. The drum is loud enough to be heard but is not over bearing. Many hours of fun were had with this drum for a little over a year until the clear skin broke. There does not seem to be a way to replace the skin, but for the reasonable price lots of fun was had.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fun for kids.
customer_reviews.text: This was a surprising hit for my niece's 4th birthday. She saw someone playing an accordion and mentioned she wanted one. I decided to get this one not knowing if she'd even remember it. Not only did she love it, all the chiller at the party were eager to take a turn with it. It's well made and provided a lot of fun for them.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L

product_meta.title: Schylling Kids Accordion
product_meta.description:
Style:AccordionOur finely crafted accordion had wood construction with a durable plastic coating. The easy to learn instruction sheet has songs included! You will be putting on a show in no time! This is a great way for a child to start to learn the accordion in a simple and easy way.

AMAZON.COM
Your child probably doesn't know Lawrence Welk or the accordion he toted around so famously for years. That should work in the favor of this sturdy, enjoyable instrument. Compact and well built, this starter instrument is a great introduction to the accordion--or just a lot of ephemeral fun. The accordion fits nicely into the palms of an adult's hands, but isn't too unwieldy for its target audience. The number of keys are minimized for ease of use and simplicity, but it's still possible to crank out a complex favorite such as "Yankee Doodle Dandy" (a brief "basic instructions" leaflet is enclosed) only 10 minutes after the instrument's out of the box. --Keith Simanton

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This finely crafted accordion looks and feels like the real thing. It includes an easy-to-learn instruction and song booklet. This accordion measures 7.50” wide, where it plays the whole scale. It is great for ages 7 and above.

See more
